text: well of course you objectives of the
seed are to deal with the nuclear issue
the implications may be wider and we
will have to wait and see I would
certainly be disappointed if the
objectives and the and the implications
were exactly the same and we could not
build more than just a nuclear issue are
on this deal of course the nuclear issue
by itself is an important achievement it
is one of the first times in probably
contemporary history when you were able
to resolve a very serious at least from
their perspective issue that has given
rise to 267 Security Council resolutions
taken they've taken us to the Security
Council adopted resolutions against us
in the Security Council for the past but
whatever seven eight years imposed all
sorts of sanctions by the Security
Council against Iran and now we've been
able to resolve that they all begin to
resolve that without military
confrontation that's that shows that
diplomacy can work diplomacy can
certainly prevail over threat over
coercion and can produce better results
because threats and coercion were used
against Iran for so many years but
probably three decades and it's three
years of diplomacy and two years of
diplomacy trumped 30 years of pressure
let's look at the deal President Obama
today talked about 24/7 access for the
inspectors he talked about inspections
which are whenever and whenever and
wherever necessary to the sensitive
sites have you agreed to this intrusive
regime of inspection well that was his
way of putting it it's an internet would
you put it it's an international regime
that is established by the Additional
Protocol does not provide for anytime
anywhere international the Additional
Protocol has very clear terms our
agreement has very clear terms and I
think the agreement is up the entire
agreement is out it's easy for people to
read it it's long and it's very much
very detailed but people can read it and
see whether it provides
anytime anywhere access but I am
confident that Iran
can in fact a surely international
community that this nuclear program is
exclusively peaceful because this
nuclear program is exclusively peaceful
so that's not the problem the problem is
every country wants to have respect for
its sovereignty respect for its military
secret respectfully scientists respect
for its military officers and we will
certainly insist on that and have
insisted on that and all our negotiating
partners understand that very well and I
think if you look at the language in the
text you will see that very clearly
reflected in the text it's it's a long
text it takes people a long time to read
it you're heading home now where you
have been hailed as a hero and accused
of being a traitor do you now accept
expect difficult political and personal
battles at home well of course I'm happy
to have it in a pluralistic society in
which people have the possibility of
expressing their views a good number of
people in Iran have a different view do
not see the world as I do
do not see the outcome of these
negotiations as argue and I give them
credit for that because there is a lot
of mistrust for for good reason of the
way the West has treated us since 1953
onward and unfortunately we haven't had
many positive episodes of cooperation I
hope this one will start to make a
different impression in Iran that people
in fact can have an agreement with the
West and West is going to respect our
taking and implement that agreement and
start to dense that wall of mistrust
that exists between us at what point in
these negotiations did you say we've got
a deal was written or was it right to
the very end that you weren't sure well
actually different intervals of the
negotiations we had a deal in the
morning and had totally failed in the
evening this was a very difficult
negotiations and part of it is because
of the this entrenched and compounded
mistrust that we have built between
ourselves mutually for the last three
four decades and part of it was because
the issues were difficult
everybody had managed to entrench
themselves in positions and situations
that was very difficult to get out of
but I'm happy that recently rate
diplomacy pre-ride people exercise great
deal of restraint and patience and
wisdom and we are where we are and I
hope this will be a good beginning
